original_title: Even If My Hands Were Full of Truths
overview: The third part of a series about the legacy of Chilean dictator Augusto Pinochet, this film is a mirror that contemplates how memory might or might not become history, using excerpts from classified CIA correspondence and a photo-montage taken at the Museum of Human Rights and Memory in Santiago. (CFMDC)
title: Even If My Hands Were Full of Truths
